Here are the latest announcements and SEC filings for the requested companies:

**IONQ (IONQ)**
*   **December 8
2025**: IonQ announced the deployment of Slovakia's first national quantum communication network through its subsidiary ID Quantique. This system
developed in partnership with the Institute of Physics
Slovak Academy of Sciences (IPSAS)

features a hybrid architecture to strengthen the country's cybersecurity infrastructure.
*   **December 5
Inc. filed an Amendment No. 1 to its Current Report on Form 8-K (8-K/A) to disclose the material terms of the separation agreement and release of claims with its former Chief Financial Officer
Thomas Kramer. Under the agreement
Kramer is set to receive a lump-sum cash severance equal to nine months of base salary
his full 2025 target bonus

and an additional pro-rated 2025 bonus. The company will also cover his health insurance premiums under COBRA for up to nine months if he elects continuation coverage.
*   **December 5
Inc. filed a Form 3
an initial statement of beneficial ownership
for its Chief Business Officer
Scott Millard. The filing disclosed Millard's direct beneficial ownership of 236
043 shares of common stock
including two restricted stock unit (RSU) awards. One RSU award covers 64
157 RSUs
with 42
771 shares vesting on December 10
and 21
386 shares vesting on December 10
2027. A second RSU award covers 171
086 RSUs
with 25% vesting on December 10

and the remainder vesting quarterly thereafter.

*   **December 8
2025**: D-Wave Quantum Inc. announced that its Qubits 2026 quantum computing user conference will be held in Boca Raton
Florida on January 27 and 28

2026. The company plans to present its latest technology roadmap for both annealing and gate-model initiatives at the event. This announcement was made via a press release attached as Exhibit 99.1 to a Current Report on Form 8-K.
*   **December 5
2025**: Director Kirstjen Nielsen sold 7
000 shares of D-Wave Quantum Inc. common stock at a price of $22.62
for a total transaction value of $158

340. This transaction was disclosed in a Form 4 filing.

2025**: D-Wave Quantum Inc. announced the formation of a new U.S. government business unit aimed at expanding the adoption of its quantum computing products and services within the U.S. government. Jack Sears Jr. was appointed as Vice President of U.S. Government Solutions to lead this unit.
